hivis.data

Interface DataValue<V>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Comparable<V>, Data
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDataValue, AbstractModifiableDataValue, AbstractUnmodifiableDataValue, AbstractValueView, CalcValue, CalcValue.DoubleValue, CalcValue.DoubleValue.FuncDV, CalcValue.DoubleValue.FuncRaw, CalcValue.DoubleValue.SeriesFunc, CalcValue.FloatValue, CalcValue.FloatValue.FuncDV, CalcValue.FloatValue.FuncRaw, CalcValue.FloatValue.SeriesFunc, CalcValue.IntValue, CalcValue.IntValue.FuncDV, CalcValue.IntValue.FuncRaw, CalcValue.IntValue.SeriesFunc, CalcValue.LongValue, CalcValue.LongValue.FuncDV, CalcValue.LongValue.FuncRaw, CalcValue.LongValue.SeriesFunc, DataValueDouble, DataValueFloat, DataValueGeneric, DataValueInteger, DataValueLong

    public interface DataValue<V>
extends Data, Comparable<V>
    Represents a single value.
    Author:
    O. J. Coleman

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      DataValue<?> add(DataValue<?> value)
      Create a view of this DataValue in which the value is the result of adding the given value to this value.
      DataValue<?> add(Number value)
      Create a view of this DataValue in which the value is the result of adding the given value to this value.
      <O> DataValue<O> apply(Function<V,O> function)
      Get a view of this DataValue that is calculated using the given function applied to this value.
      DataValue<Double> asDouble()
      Get a view of this DataValue representing the value as a double-precision floating point number.
      DataValue<Float> asFloat()
      Get a view of this DataValue representing the value as a single-precision floating point number.
      DataValue<Integer> asInt()
      Get a view of this DataValue representing the value as an integer.
      DataValue<Long> asLong()
      Get a view of this DataValue representing the value as a long integer.
      DataValue<?> divide(DataValue<?> value)
      Create a view of this DataValue in which the value is the result of dividing this value by the given value.
      DataValue<?> divide(Number value)
      Create a view of this DataValue in which the value is the result of dividing this value by the given value.

      Get the value, if set, otherwise returns getEmptyValue().

      Get an independent and immutable copy of this DataValue (the returned value cannot be modified, and changes to this value will not be reflected in the returned value).

      • Methods inherited from interface hivis.data.Data

        addChangeListener, addContainer, beginChanges, changeInProgress, equalTo, equalToHashCode, finishChanges, getContainers, getCurrentChangers, hasDataChanged, isMutable, lock, removeChangeListener, removeContainer, setDataChanged, unlock

      • Methods inherited from interface java.lang.Comparable

        compareTo

    • Method Detail

      • get

        V get()
        Get the value, if set, otherwise returns getEmptyValue().

      • setValue

        void setValue(V value)
        Set the value. This method should only be used when the new value is exactly the same type represented by this DataValue. In general it is best to use set(Object).

      • set

        void set(Object value)
        Set the value. Attempts to cast the given object to the type represented by this DataValue. For typed value setting use setValue(Object).
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given object cannot be cast to the type represented by this DataValue.

      • getEmptyValue

        V getEmptyValue()
        Get the value corresponding to an empty value. For floating-point numbers this is either Double.NaN or Float.NaN. For integer types it is Long.MIN_VALUE, Integer.MIN_VALUE, etc. For all other types this is usually null.

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Returns true iff the value is considered empty
        See Also:
        getEmptyValue()

      • getType

        Class<?> getType()
        Return the Class of the type represented by this DataValue.

      • getBoolean

        boolean getBoolean()
        Get the value as the primitive type 'boolean'. This is an optional operation, not all DataValue implementations support it, in which case an UnsupportedOperationException will be thrown. It is provided to allow more efficient access to DataValues that store boolean values as a primitive type (to avoid auto-boxing).

      • getInt

        int getInt()
        Get the value as the primitive type 'int'. This is an optional operation, not all DataValue implementations support it, in which case an UnsupportedOperationException will be thrown. It is provided to allow more efficient access to DataValues that store int values as a primitive type (to avoid auto-boxing).

      • getLong

        long getLong()
        Get the value as the primitive type 'long'. This is an optional operation, not all DataValue implementations support it, in which case an UnsupportedOperationException will be thrown. It is provided to allow more efficient access to DataValues that store long values as a primitive type (to avoid auto-boxing).

      • getFloat

        float getFloat()
        Get the value as the primitive type 'float'. This is an optional operation, not all DataValue implementations support it, in which case an UnsupportedOperationException will be thrown. It is provided to allow more efficient access to DataValues that store float values as a primitive type (to avoid auto-boxing) and to simplify working with APIs that use float by default.

      • getDouble

        double getDouble()
        Get the value as the primitive type 'double'. This is an optional operation, not all DataValue implementations support it, in which case an UnsupportedOperationException will be thrown. It is provided to allow more efficient access to DataValues that store double values as a primitive type (to avoid auto-boxing).

      • asFloat

        DataValue<Float> asFloat()
        Get a view of this DataValue representing the value as a single-precision floating point number.

      • asDouble

        DataValue<Double> asDouble()
        Get a view of this DataValue representing the value as a double-precision floating point number.

      • asInt

        DataValue<Integer> asInt()
        Get a view of this DataValue representing the value as an integer.

      • asLong

        DataValue<Long> asLong()
        Get a view of this DataValue representing the value as a long integer.

      • getNewDataValue

        DataValue<V> getNewDataValue()
        Get an empty DataValue of the same type as this DataValue.

      • immutableCopy

        DataValue<V> immutableCopy()
        Get an independent and immutable copy of this DataValue (the returned value cannot be modified, and changes to this value will not be reflected in the returned value).
        Specified by:
        immutableCopy in interface Data

      • isNumeric

        boolean isNumeric()
        Returns true iff this DataValue represents a numeric value.

      • apply

        <O> DataValue<O> apply(Function<V,O> function)
        Get a view of this DataValue that is calculated using the given function applied to this value.
        Parameters:
        function - The function to calculate the new value from the original value.

      • add

        DataValue<?> add(Number value)
        Create a view of this DataValue in which the value is the result of adding the given value to this value.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to add.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if this value is not numeric.

      • add

        DataValue<?> add(DataValue<?> value)
        Create a view of this DataValue in which the value is the result of adding the given value to this value.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to add. Changes to the DataValue will be reflected in the returned value.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if this or the given value are not numeric.

      • subtract

        DataValue<?> subtract(Number value)
        Create a view of this DataValue in which the value is the result of subtracting the given value from this value.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to subtract.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if this value is not numeric.

      • subtract

        DataValue<?> subtract(DataValue<?> value)
        Create a view of this DataValue in which the value is the result of subtracting the given value from this value.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to subtract. Changes to the DataValue will be reflected in the returned value.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if this or the given value are not numeric.

      • multiply

        DataValue<?> multiply(Number value)
        Create a view of this DataValue in which the value is the result of multiplying the given value by this value.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to multiply by.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if this value is not numeric.

      • multiply

        DataValue<?> multiply(DataValue<?> value)
        Create a view of this DataValue in which the value is the result of multiplying the given value by this value.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to multiply by. Changes to the DataValue will be reflected in the returned value.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if this or the given value are not numeric.

        Create a view of this DataValue in which the value is the result of dividing this value by the given value.

        Create a view of this DataValue in which the value is the result of dividing this value by the given value.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to divide by. Changes to the DataValue will be reflected in the returned value.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if this or the given value are not numeric.
